comments_since_last_sample.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.

Reading academic papers about topics, and books about the subjects help you somehow model that style of writing just by reading it. I used to do it for research papers just reading bunch of academic related articles helped me.

Unfortunately I am very very ignorant of other cultures so I don't know if the exam is in an american/English speaking school. If it is, speak with your professor regarding this.

If not, find a community of primarily English speaking individuals to practice.

As much as we make fun of it, Duo Lingo is also very good at teaching sentence structure. But it's vocabulary is garbage.

Try contacting a university department that teaches your language. They could advise you since they know your language and English. Find online groups of other people like you who are going to take the test and network with them. I agree that your written English is very good!

I am an Englishman,living in England,speaking English.

Your grammar is fine mate....infact you speak it better than most of the yokels here lol.

dont sweat it.
So I would find a discord where you can speak English with English speakers and non native speakers so you can increase your English proficiency. My friend who’s desi does that.
